content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Look for an English language book on roman empire history in the Amazon Kindle store. Sort by newests arrivals and look for a title that will be released within a month.  Please interact with https://www.amazon.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is a popup asking whether to stay on Amazon.com or switch to Amazon.ca. To proceed with the task on the Amazon.com Kindle store, I need to select "Stay on Amazon.com".
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.05
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search box is visible at the top, which I can use to begin searching for an English language book on Roman Empire history in the Kindle store. This is the first step in the task.
Action: Type [2]; roman empire history kindle
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results are filtered for "roman empire history kindle". To proceed with the task, I need to sort the results by "Newest Arrivals" to find a title that will be released within a month. I should interact with the sort dropdown menu.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sort options dropdown is open and "Newest Arrivals" (label [42]) is visible. Selecting this will sort books by their release date, which is required to find the newest books, including those to be released within a month.
Action: Click [42]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results are now sorted by "Newest Arrivals". I can see the first book, "The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire", but it was published on April 11, 2022, which is not within the next month. I should scroll down to look for a Kindle book with a future release date (within the next month).
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible results still only show books already released (2021, per the dates), not a title to be released within a month. I need to scroll further to look for newly listed, not-yet-released Kindle books on Roman Empire history.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results still only show previously released books, not upcoming titles. I have not yet seen a Kindle book on Roman Empire history with a release date within the next month. I need to continue scrolling to find any upcoming releases.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.94
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current visible results show more Roman Empire history books, but all have already been released (as indicated by listings like "Available instantly" and the listed dates in previous iterations). I still have not found a book with a future release date within the next month. I should continue scrolling to find one.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results in the screenshot continue to show only previously released titles, with no indication of upcoming Kindle books on Roman Empire history releasing within a month. To complete the task, I must keep looking for a book with a future release date.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results shown are still previously published books (latest: 2017 and earlier), available instantly, and do not match the requirement for a Kindle title releasing within the next month. I need to continue searching for upcoming releases by scrolling further.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The books listed ("SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome" and "The History of The Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire") are available instantly or were published years ago and do not have a future release date. There is still no sign of a Kindle book on Roman Empire history releasing within the next month. Need to keep searching further.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The books currently visible are still all previously released: "History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire - Volume 1" (2012) and "Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire" (2010). None are upcoming Kindle releases within the next month. I need to keep looking further by scrolling.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.9

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.

None have a future release date within the upcoming month. I still need to keep searching for upcoming Kindle releases.

content:
Thought: In this screenshot, the book "The Wolves of Mars: An Introductory History of Rome from the Rise of the Monarchy to the Fall of the Western Empire" by Aeon History is visible with a release date of June 10, 2024—which is within the next month. However, based on the visible tags and formats, only a paperback is shown and not a Kindle edition. I should verify if a Kindle version exists or if this is only available in paperback.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.95

Thought: The previous scroll showed a new book titled "The Wolves of Mars: An Introductory History of Rome from the Rise of the Monarchy to the Fall of the Western Empire" with a release date of June 10, 2024, but only listed the paperback version. In this screenshot, the visible result ("Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire") does have a Kindle version, but it is not a new arrival. I should scroll back down to confirm the book format options for "The Wolves of Mars" to check definitively for a Kindle edition.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.95
